intro: Pagamea brevipedunculata, commonly known as the short-stalked pagamea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Arecaceae family, which includes palms, and is characterized by its slender, unbranched stems. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear both male and female flowers, typical of many palm species. Its leaves are usually pinnately compound, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
